messages.subject: Re: New Week's Resolutions tested...
messages.msgSnippet: ***Ms. Superiority strikes again.  Did anybody say these book recommendations were for kids and does that really matter? and does it really matter if those
messages.messageBody:
***Ms. Superiority strikes again. Did anybody say these book
recommendations were for kids and does that really matter? and does it
really matter if those kids are schooled or unschooled? and did anybody say
or even infer that one should stop at either of those references and shut
the book, declaring them the gospel? NO. ANY person that knows squat about
unschooling knows that one resource is rarely the 'end all, be all'.
Sandra has plenty of opportunities to voice her opinion here and elsewhere
(HEM, for instance) and that is not so much my point as is the fact that she
chooses to belittle so many other peoples' suggestions, ideas and
opinions.***

Lots of people don't like fairness and honesty (G-d knows I have been one of
them, and it's been part of my attempt at evolution NOT to be. "I'm getting
better.")

I could reduce this to name-calling, too, but that doesn't seem useful (to
me or to anyone here), so I'll keep it to this request:

Rather than posting "we don't need" (referring to this list), please post
for yourself. And it would be REALLY nice (though probably totally
unrealistic of me to ask) if you could keep the topic on the IDEAS of Sandra
or me or anyone else, rather than about your like or dislike of the person
involved, and rather than calling people Ms. Superiority, or bands of merry
makers, or Boogerheads for that matter.

Pam, you can call me "Al"
